body: LEAD: To the Editor: To the Editor: A little more than a year and a half ago, you published an article of mine (Op-Ed, Aug. 12, 1985) about the language of gentrification in our cities, and especially the erroneous and insulting use of frontier imagery -''urban pioneers'' for example - to discuss gentrifying neighborhoods and their existing

body: LEAD: Lavonne Hill, a Seneca Indian from upstate New York, spoke of a Mohawk friend who wanted to return to the reservation and her roots.
